Ladies and gentlemen, I welcome and very much support your efforts to translate the resource efficiency approach into true added value for Environmental Protection and competitiveness.

You will know that resource efficiency is a subject close to my heart and the key priority for my mandate and by applying lifecycle thinking to product and services, the cradle to cradle concept supports our resource efficiency aims.

This aims to transform Europe into a knowledge based economy which values and uses resources responsibly.

It forces us to make the best possible use of all of them in a sustainable way.
The Resource Efficiency Initiative in Europe 2020 will also promote the lifecycle thinking and lifecycle assessment concepts.
Both of these are already a part of our environmental policies on products, waste management and recycling.

I hope you can see that we understand the concept.
And I was pleased to see that you have chosen priorities, industry, spatial development and governance where we are working to.
On the industry, we will continue implementing our lifecycle and recycling policies such as the sustainable consumption and Production action plan and our waste legislation.
We know that Greening the whole economy is important in the long term.

Governance is also one of my priorities.

It will also mean bringing Member States and regions on board your network and others.
It's helping us to do this.
We also need business behind us and we need to change production and consumption patterns and to do this we need strong political support.
